item.title: Felicity add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Art never responds to the wish to make it democratic; it is not for everybody; it is only for those who are willing to undergo the effort needed to understand it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Mervyn Peake
item.description: "This tower, patched unevenly with black ivy, arose like a mutilated finger from among the fists of knuckled masonry and pointed blasphemously at heaven. At night the owls made of it an echoing throat; by day it stood voiceless and cast its long shadow." -- Mervyn Peake

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "And [Asimov]'ll sign anything, hardbacks, softbacks, other people's books, scraps of paper. Inevitably someone handed him a blank check on the occasion when I was there, and he signed that without as much as a waver to his smile — except that he signed: 'Harlan Ellison." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Marvin Bell
item.description: "The war to preserve the privilege of mythmaking" -- Marvin Bell

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "I sew his ears on from time to time, sure." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For books continue each other, in spite of our habit of judging them separately." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "There is no excuse for anyone to write fiction for public consumption unless he has been called to do so by the presence of a gift. It is the nature of fiction not to be good for much unless it is good in itself." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Sherwood Anderson
item.description: "The fruition of the year had come and the night should have been fine with a moon in the sky and the crisp sharp promise of frost in the air, but it wasn't that way. It rained and little puddles of water shone under the street lamps on Main Street. In the woods in the darkness beyond the Fair Ground water dripped from the black trees." -- Sherwood Anderson

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Charles Baxter
item.description: "There is such a thing as the poetry of a mistake, and when you say, "Mistakes were made," you deprive an action of its poetry, and you sound like a weasel." -- Charles Baxter

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Charles Baxter
item.description: "When all the details fit in perfectly, something is probably wrong with the story." -- Charles Baxter

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "But you know as well as I, patriotism is a word; and one that generally comes to mean either <i>my country, right or wrong</i>, which is infamous, or <i>my country is always right</i>, which is imbecile." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I could end this with a moral, as if this were a fable about animals, though no fables are really about animals." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Pam Houston
Felicity add a quote by Pam Houston
item.description:
"Do you write novels?" I said.
"Novels, Lord no," she said. "I can't even stay married." -- Pam Houston

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Pam Houston
item.description: "The more important question, of course, was what the new Lucy would do, and even though I was pretty sure the old Lucy wouldn't be around much anymore, I was a little bit afraid the new Lucy hadn't yet shown up." -- Pam Houston

item.title: Felicity add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "But it isn't easy,' said Pooh. 'Because Poetry and Hums aren't things which you get, they're things which get you. And all you can do is to go where they can find you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Charles Baxter
item.description: "The twentieth century has built up a powerful set of intellectual shortcuts and devices that help us defend ourselves against moments when clouds suddenly appear to think." -- Charles Baxter

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "All this pitting of sex against sex, of quality against quality; all this claiming of superiority and imputing of inferiority, belong to the private-school stage of human existence where there are 'sides,' and it is necessary for one side to beat another side, and of the utmost importance to walk up to a platform and receive from the hands of the Headmaster himself a highly ornamental pot." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Felicity add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Trees're always a relief, after people." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Judith Minty
item.description: "I give you this to take with you: Nothing remains as it was. If you know this, you can begin again, with pure joy in the uprooting." -- Judith Minty

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Leslie What
item.description: "It was like hiking into a Hemingway story; everything was sepia-toned and bristling with subtext." -- Leslie What

item.title: Felicity add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "Daniel supposed he had a secret life. Most people did; it was hardly possible to live without one." -- P.D. James

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Basically, Sherri's idea had to do with bringing Fat's mind down from the cosmic and the abstract to the particular. She had hatched out the practical notion that nothing is more real than a large World War Two Soviet tank." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Fat realized that one of two possibilities existed and only two; either Dr. Stone was totally insane – not just insane but totally so – or else in an artful, professional fashion he had gotten Fat to talk; he had drawn Fat out and now knew that Fat was totally insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Felicity add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "It is difficult to be generous-minded to those we have greatly harmed." -- P.D. James

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "What fabrications they are, mothers. Scarecrows, wax dolls for us to stick pins into, crude diagrams. We deny them an existence of their own, we make them up to suit ourselves -- our own hungers, our own wishes, our own deficiencies." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Perhaps I write for no one. Perhaps for the same person children are writing for when they scrawl their names in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If you knew what was going to happen, if you knew everything that was going to happen next—if you knew in advance the consequences of your own actions—you'd be doomed. You'd be ruined as God. You'd be a stone. You'd never eat or drink or laugh or get out of bed in the morning. You'd never love anyone, ever again. You'd never dare to." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Felicity add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Was this a betrayal, or was it an act of courage? Perhaps both. Neither one involves forethought: such things take place in an instant, in an eyeblink. This can only be because they have been rehearsed by us already, over and over, in silence and darkness; in such silence, such darkness, that we are ignorant of them ourselves. Blind but sure-footed, we step forward as if into a remembered dance." -- Margaret Atwood
